actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: To prohibit the denial or abridgment of the right of former criminal offenders to vote in elections for Federal office.

summary.text: States that the right of a U.S. citizen to vote in a Federal election shall not be denied or abridged because he has committed a criminal offense (unless such citizen is imprisoned in a correctional institution at the time of such election). Provides criminal penalties for intentionally denying a person such right.

titles.title: To prohibit the denial or abridgment of the right of former criminal offenders to vote in elections for Federal office.
